Welcome to SquirrelUno’s Documentation!

Welcome to the official documentation for SquirrelUno, an innovative project developed by Dominik Krenn that brings a unique twist to the classic Uno card game. This comprehensive guide provides all the necessary information to understand, install, and effectively utilize SquirrelUno.

Warning

Important Notice: SquirrelUno is an independent hobby project. The software may have stability and security issues and is in continuous development. Use at your own risk.

Overview

SquirrelUno is designed to offer a fun and engaging card game experience with unique features and enhancements over the traditional Uno game. Whether you are a developer looking to contribute or a player eager to enjoy a new version of Uno, this documentation will guide you through every step.

Getting Started

To get started with SquirrelUno, please refer to the introduction section. For installation instructions, see the installation guide. To learn how to use the application, visit the usage section. Detailed API documentation is available in the api section.

Indices and Tables

  • Index

  • Module Index

  • Search Page

Introduction

The introduction section provides a high-level overview of SquirrelUno, its features, and its purpose.

Installation

The installation section guides users through the process of installing SquirrelUno, including prerequisites, detailed steps for both local and GitHub installations, and verification procedures.

Usage

The usage section offers comprehensive instructions on how to run and interact with SquirrelUno, detailing commands, flags, and expected outputs.

API Documentation

The api documentation provides an in-depth look at the SquirrelUno codebase, explaining the structure, functions, classes, and methods available for developers who wish to extend or customize the game.

Additional Resources

For more information, refer to the indices and search features to help you quickly locate the information you need:
